com.stormpath.sdk.organization

Interface Organization

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AccountStore, AccountStoreHolder<Organization>, Auditable, Deletable, Extendable, Resource, Saveable

    public interface Organization
extends AccountStoreHolder<Organization>, Resource, Saveable, Deletable, AccountStore, Extendable, Auditable
    An Organization is a top-level container of Directories and Groups. Directories and Groups are guaranteed to be unique within an Organization, but not across multiple Organizations. A Organization's name is guaranteed to be unique across all of a Tenant's organizations.

    You can think of an Organization as a 'virtual' AccountStore that 'wraps' other AccountStores. Like other AccountStores, an Organization can be mapped to an Application so that users in the Organization can login to that application.

    Since:
    1.0.RC7

      • getStatus

        OrganizationStatus getStatus()
        Returns the Organization's status.

        An enabled organization may be used as a 'virtual' AccountStore that 'wraps' other AccountStores. Like other AccountStores, an Organization can be mapped to an Application so that users in the Organization can login to that application. A disabled organization cannot be used to store Directories or Groups.

        Returns:
        the organization's status.

      • setStatus

        Organization setStatus(OrganizationStatus status)

        An enabled organization may be used as a 'virtual' AccountStore that 'wraps' other AccountStores. Like other AccountStores, an Organization can be mapped to an Application so that users in the Organization can login to that application. A disabled organization cannot be used to store Directories or Groups.

        Parameters:
        status - the status to apply.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getAccountStoreMappings

        OrganizationAccountStoreMappingList getAccountStoreMappings()
        Returns all AccountStoreMappings accessible to the Organization.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all organizationAccountStoreMappings, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more organizationAccountStoreMappings using the getAccountStoreMappings() (java.util.Map)} method or the (com.stormpath.sdk.organization.OrganizationAccountStoreMappingCriteria) instead of this one.

        Returns:
        all OrganizationAccountStoreMapping resources accessible to the organization.
        See Also:
        getAccountStoreMappings(java.util.Map), getAccountStoreMappings(com.stormpath.sdk.organization.OrganizationAccountStoreMappingCriteria)

      • getAccountStoreMappings

        OrganizationAccountStoreMappingList getAccountStoreMappings(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the organization's mapped Account stores that also match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../organizations/organizationId/accountStoreMappings?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...

        This is a type-unsafe alternative to the getAccountStoreMappings(organizationAccountStoreMappingCriteria) method, and might be useful when using dynamic languages like Groovy or JRuby. Users of compiled languages, or those that like IDE-completion, might favor the type-safe method instead.

        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the organization's mapped account stores that match the specified query criteria.
        See Also:
        getAccountStoreMappings(com.stormpath.sdk.organization.OrganizationAccountStoreMappingCriteria)

      • getAccountStoreMappings

        OrganizationAccountStoreMappingList getAccountStoreMappings(OrganizationAccountStoreMappingCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the organization's mapped Account stores that also match the specified query criteria. The OrganizationAccountStoreMappings utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         organization.getAccountStoreMappings(OrganizationAccountStoreMappings.criteria()
     .withAccountStore()
     .orderByListIndex();
        or, if using static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.organization.OrganizationAccountStoreMappings.*;

 ...

 organization.getAccountStoreMappings(criteria()
     .withAccountStore()
     .orderByListIndex();
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the organization's mapped account stores that match the specified query criteria.

      • createAccount

        Account createAccount(Account account)
               throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Account that may login to this application.

        This is mostly a convenience method; it delegates creation to the Application's designated defaultAccountStore, and functions as follows:

        • If the defaultAccountStore is a Directory: the account is created in the Directory and returned.
        • If the defaultAccountStore is a Group: the account is created in the Group's Directory, assigned to the Group, and then returned.

        Parameters:
        account - the account to create/persist
        Returns:
        a new Account that may login to this application.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the Application does not have a designated defaultAccountStore or if the designated defaultAccountStore does not allow new accounts to be created.

      • createAccount

        Account createAccount(CreateAccountRequest request)
               throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Account that may login to this application according to the request criteria.

        This is mostly a convenience method; it delegates creation to the Application's designated defaultAccountStore, and functions as follows:

        • If the defaultAccountStore is a Directory: the account is created in the Directory and returned.
        • If the defaultAccountStore is a Group: the account is created in the Group's Directory, assigned to the Group, and then returned.

        Example

              organization.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).build());

        If you would like to force disabling the backing directory's account registration workflow: 

              organization.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).setRegistrationWorkflowEnabled(false).build());
        If you would like to force the execution of the registration workflow, no matter what the backing directory configuration is: 
              organization.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).setRegistrationWorkflowEnabled(true).build());
        If you would like to retrieve the account's custom data in the response of the account creation. 
              organization.createAccount(Accounts.newCreateRequestFor(account).withResponseOptions(Accounts.options().withCustomData()).build());

        Parameters:
        request - the account creation request
        Returns:
        a new Account that may login to this application.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the Application does not have a designated defaultAccountStore or if the designated defaultAccountStore does not allow new accounts to be created.

      • createOrganizationAccountStoreMapping

        OrganizationAccountStoreMapping createOrganizationAccountStoreMapping(OrganizationAccountStoreMapping mapping)
                                                               throws ResourceException
        Creates a new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping for this Organization, allowing the associated accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the applications related to this Organization.

        Usage Notice: Unlike other methods in this class that require the Saveable.save() method to be called to persist changes, this convenience method will call the server immediately.

        Authentication Process and OrganizationAccountStoreMapping Order

        During an authentication attempt, an Organization consults its mapped account stores in iteration order, trying to find the first matching account to use for authentication. The lower the OrganizationAccountStoreMapping index (closer to zero), the earlier that store is consulted during authentication. If no matching account is found in an account store, the organization will move on to the next AccountStore (next highest index) in the list. This continues either a matching account is found, or until all account stores are exhausted. When a matching account is found, the process is short-circuited and the discovered account will be used immediately for authentication.

        When calling this method, you control where the new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping will reside in the Organization's overall list by setting its (zero-based) listIndex property before calling this method.

        listIndex values

        • negative: attempting to set a negative listIndex will cause an Error
        • zero: the account store mapping will be the first item in the list (and therefore consulted first during the authentication process).
        • positive: the account store mapping will be inserted at that index. Because list indices are zero-based, the account store will be in the list at position listIndex - 1.
        Any listIndex value equal to or greater than the current list size will automatically append the OrganizationAccountStoreMapping at the end of the list.

        Example

        Setting a new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping's listIndex to 500 and then adding the mapping to an organization with an existing 3-item list will automatically save the OrganizationAccountStoreMapping at the end of the list and set its listIndex value to 3 (items at index 0, 1, 2 were the original items, the new fourth item will be at index 3). 
         AccountStore directoryOrGroup = getDirectoryOrGroupYouWantToUseForLogin();
 OrganizationAccountStoreMapping mapping = client.instantiate(OrganizationAccountStoreMapping.class);
 mapping.setAccountStore(directoryOrGroup);
 mapping.setListIndex(3); //this is zero-based, so index 3 == 4th item
 mapping = organization.createAccountStoreMapping(mapping);
        Then, when authenticating an account, this AccountStore (directory or group) will be consulted if no others before it in the list found a matching account.
        Parameters:
        mapping - the new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping resource to add to the Organization's OrganizationAccountStoreMapping list.
        Returns:
        the newly created OrganizationAccountStoreMapping instance.
        Throws:
        ResourceException

      • addAccountStore

        OrganizationAccountStoreMapping addAccountStore(AccountStore accountStore)
                                         throws ResourceException
        Creates a new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping for this Organization and appends that OrganizationAccountStoreMapping to the end of the Organization's OrganizationAccountStoreMapping list, allowing the association accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Organization.

        Usage Notice: Unlike other methods in this class that require the Saveable.save() method to be called to persist changes, this convenience method will call the server immediately.

        Authentication Process and OrganizationAccountStoreMapping Order

        During an authentication attempt, an organization consults its mapped account stores in iteration order, trying to find the first matching account to use for authentication. The lower the OrganizationAccountStoreMapping index (closer to zero), the earlier that store is consulted during authentication. If no matching account is found in an account store, the organization will move on to the next AccountStore (next highest index) in the list. This continues either a matching account is found, or until all account stores are exhausted. When a matching account is found, the process is short-circuited and the discovered account will be used immediately for authentication.

        When calling this method, you are setting the new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping to the end of the Organization's overall list.

        NOTE: If you already know the account store where the account resides, you can specify it at the time the authentication request is created (for example, UsernamePasswordRequest.UsernamePasswordRequest(String, char[], com.stormpath.sdk.directory.AccountStore)). This way you will be avoiding the authentication attempt to cycle through the Organization's account stores.

        Example

         AccountStore directoryOrGroup = getDirectoryOrGroupYouWantToUseForLogin();
 OrganizationAccountStoreMapping mapping = application.addAccountStore(directoryOrGroup);
        Then, when authenticating an account, this AccountStore (directory or group) will be consulted if no others before it in the list found a matching account.
        Parameters:
        accountStore - the new AccountStore resource to add to the Organization's OrganizationAccountStoreMapping list.
        Returns:
        the newly created OrganizationAccountStoreMapping instance.
        Throws:
        ResourceException

      • addAccountStore

        OrganizationAccountStoreMapping addAccountStore(String hrefOrName)
        Convenience method to add a a new AccountStore to this organization.

        The given String can be either an 'href' or a 'name' of a Directory or a Group belonging to the current Tenant.

        If the provided value is an 'href', this method will get the proper Resource and add it as a new AccountStore in this Organization without much effort. However, if the provided value is not an 'href', it will be considered as a 'name'. In this case, this method will search for both a Directory and a Group whose names equal the provided hrefOrName. If only one resource exists (either a Directory or a Group), then it will be added as a new AccountStore in this Organization. However, if there are two resources (a Directory and a Group) matching that name, a ResourceException will be thrown.

        At the end of this process, if a single matching resource is found, this method will then delegate the actual OrganizationAccountStoreMapping creation to the addAccountStore(AccountStore) method in order to fulfill its task.

        Example providing an href: 

              OrganizationAccountStoreMapping accountStoreMapping = organization.addAccountStore("https://api.stormpath.com/v1/groups/2rwq022yMt4u2DwKLfzriP");
        Example providing a name: 

              OrganizationAccountStoreMapping accountStoreMapping = organization.addAccountStore("Foo Name");
        USAGE NOTE 1: When using 'names' this method is not efficient as it will search for both Directories and Groups within this Tenant for a matching name. In order to do so, some looping takes place at the client side: groups exist within directories, therefore we need to loop through every existing directory in order to find the required Group. In contrast, providing the Group's 'href' is much more efficient as no actual search operation needs to be carried out.

        USAGE NOTE 2: Unlike other methods in this class that require the Saveable.save() method to be called to persist changes, this is a convenience method and will call the server immediately.

        Parameters:
        hrefOrName - either the 'href' or the 'name' of the desired Directory or Group.
        Returns:
        the OrganizationAccountStoreMapping created after finding the actual resource described by hrefOrName. It returns null if there is no group or directory matching the href or name given.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the resource already exists as an account store in this organization.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given hrefOrName matches more than one resource in the current Tenant.
        See Also:
        addAccountStore(AccountStore)

      • createGroup

        Group createGroup(Group group)
           throws ResourceException
        Creates a new group that may be used by this organization in the organization's defaultGroupStore

        This is a convenience method. It merely delegates to the Organization's designated defaultGroupStore.

        Parameters:
        group - the Group to create/persist
        Returns:
        a new Group that may be used by this organization.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the Organization does not have a designated defaultGroupStore or if the designated defaultGroupStore does not allow new groups to be created.

      • createGroup

        Group createGroup(CreateGroupRequest request)
        Creates a new group that may be used by this organization in the organization's defaultGroupStore

        This is a convenience method. It merely delegates to the Organization's designated defaultGroupStore.

        Example

              organization.createGroup(Groups.newCreateRequestFor(group).build());

        If you would like to retrieve the group's custom data in the response of the groups creation. 

              organization.createGroup(Groups.newCreateRequestFor(group).withResponseOptions(Groups.options().withCustomData()).build());
        Parameters:
        request - the group creation request
        Returns:
        a new Group that may be used by this organization.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the Organization does not have a designated defaultGroupsStore or if the designated defaultGroupsStore does not allow new groups to be created.
